_comment: Created by EFisher on 24/01/2014 16:53:57 using v2.0
title: Have there been changes in staff reporting being ill or work related stress?
analysis_commentary: In 2004 and 2005, around 35% of staff reported that they had been ill due to work-related stress. This fell by approximately 7 percentage points to lows in 2008 and 2009. From 2010, the number of staff reporting stress began to increase again and there was a sharp increase in reporting of stress between 2011 and 2012. Between these time periods there was an 8 percentage point increase, representing a +27% change, which is more than the total decrease observed in staff reporting stress between 2004 and 2008.
data_source: Department of Health, Survey of NHS staff
